title: Is it normal to still think about small ultimately negligible injustices that happened years ago that other people have probably forgotten? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes. Our brains are wired to remember the bad things as a survival instinct. Before civilization, animals hunted us. Some plants poisoned us. Our brains hold that to be of primary importance. We just have less important bad things in there now. Someone teasing you is in the spot in your brain our ancestors put lions and bears.
